posts.post_content:
A friend and messing around with standard and new M13 stuff, trying to break something. This gets imprinted on a [Myr Welder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Welder). Then a [Soliton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soliton) gets imprinted on it. Then I die to [Sands of Delirium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sands of Delirium).
  
   
I wish the format was slow enough for things like this to happen in competitive play...
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Its funny how they fixed most of the power 9 by making it cost ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol).   
  
[Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall) = [Jace's Ingenuity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Ingenuity)  
[Time Twister](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Twister) = [Time Reversal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Reversal)  
[Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk) = [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp)  
[Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) = [Gilded Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded Lotus)

posts.post_content:
Go Infinite Mana in Standard  
  
[Dead-Eye Navigator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dead-Eye Navigator) Soul binds [Zealous Con](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zealous Con)  
  
than when he enters battlefield you target [Gilded Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded Lotus)  
  
Lotus can give 3 mana each time Zealous uses 2 to exile and return giving infinite mana to take control of all your stuff, and on their turn take control of all their permanents as well. Enjoy   
  
5/5

Posted By: BryceCarmony (8/20/2013 10:44:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
With [Ral Zarek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ral Zarek) in play this just became playable. I remember passing this card along in Draft just because it was too cumbersome to play on Turn 5, yep you basically wasted 5 mana to get back 3 mana, expending 2 mana for nothing.
  
   
But with Ral Zarek out you can typically tap 5 to play this, get 3 mana, then untap, and get another 3 mana. So in the end you are paying 5, to gain 6 mana. Netting you 1 mana more! you are probably thinking what is the difference between 5 mana and 6 at this point? [Niv Mizzet, Dracogenius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv Mizzet, Dracogenius) thats who!
posts.html:

Rating:

posts.post_content: sadly, (at least in my meta) it doesn't see much standard play, since if you can make it to 5 you can play most of your win cons already. [thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thragtusk), for example. Control decks often have either better 5 drops, can stall long enough to not need the ramp, or use [farseek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=farseek) since it can be reused with snapcaster or simply played once or early to mid game to fix the mana base. I really like this card, i just wish it was more viable right now. Maybe i'm not doing it right..
posts.html:
